keywords.value: White Helmets (Syrian Civil Defense Volunteer Group)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from the United Nations, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Raed Saleh, of the Syria Civil Defense group, was to accept an award from InterAction, an alliance of international aid agencies. He was stopped at Washington’s Dulles International Airport.

headline.print_headline: Aid Worker From Syria Is Denied  Entry to U.S.
headline.main: Leader of Syria Rescue Group, Arriving in U.S. for Award, Is Refused Entry

snippet: Raed Saleh, of the Syria Civil Defense group, was to accept an award from InterAction, an alliance of international aid agencies. He was stopped at Washington’s Dulles International Airport.
abstract: Raed Al-Saleh, leader of Syria Civil Defense, rescue organization backed by Western governments, is denied entry into United States after he is informed his visa has been canceled; State Dept officials are unable to confirm whether Al-Saleh's name had been fed into terrorist watch list; Al-Saleh was scheduled to receive award given by InterAction for his contributions to humanitarian relief.
